lessons.title: Candlestick Fundamentals
lessons.content:
# 🕯 Candlestick Basics

## 🎯 Goal
Learn what candlesticks are, how OHLC works, bullish vs bearish candles, wicks, dojis, and trend/consolidation concepts.

## 📊 What You'll Learn

• **OHLC Data** — Open, High, Low, Close
• **Bullish vs Bearish** candles and what they mean
• **Wicks and Shadows** — volatility indicators
• **Doji Patterns** — market indecision signals
• **Trend vs Consolidation** identification

## 🕯 Candlestick Anatomy

**Body (Open to Close):**
• Green body = bullish (close > open)
• Red body = bearish (close < open)
• Large body = strong momentum
• Small body = indecision

**Wicks/Shadows (High/Low):**
• Long upper wick = rejection of highs
• Long lower wick = rejection of lows
• No wicks = strong directional move
• Long wicks = volatility and indecision

## 🔍 Key Patterns

**Doji:**
• Small body, long wicks
• Market indecision
• Potential reversal signal
• Volume confirms direction

**Hammer/Hanging Man:**
• Long lower wick, small body
• Hammer = bullish reversal
• Hanging man = bearish reversal
• Context matters

**Shooting Star/Inverted Hammer:**
• Long upper wick, small body
• Shooting star = bearish
• Inverted hammer = bullish
• Location is key

## 📈 Trend vs Consolidation

**Trending Candles:**
• Consistent body direction
• Small wicks
• Higher highs, higher lows (uptrend)
• Lower highs, lower lows (downtrend)

**Consolidation Candles:**
• Mixed body directions
• Long wicks
• Sideways price action
• Breakout potential

## 💡 Why No XP Yet
This is foundation knowledge — reward comes when you can apply it in a full chart analysis.

## 📝 Mini-Task (Optional)
Identify a recent candlestick on a chart and label its open, high, low, and close. Note whether it's bullish or bearish and what the wicks tell you about market sentiment.

lessons.title: RSI Fundamentals
lessons.content:
# 📈 RSI & Momentum Indicators

## 🎯 Goal
Master the Relative Strength Index (RSI) and understand momentum indicators for identifying overbought/oversold conditions and potential reversals.

## 📊 What You'll Learn

• **RSI Basics** — What it measures and how it works
• **Overbought/Oversold** — Key levels and their significance
• **Divergence** — When price and RSI disagree
• **Momentum Shifts** — Identifying trend changes
• **False Signals** — When RSI lies and how to spot it

## 📈 RSI Anatomy

**The Formula:**
• RSI = 100 - (100 / (1 + RS))
• RS = Average Gain / Average Loss
• Default period = 14 (adjustable)

**Key Levels:**
• **70+** = Overbought (potential reversal down)
• **30-** = Oversold (potential reversal up)
• **50** = Neutral (trend continuation)
• **20/80** = Extreme levels (strong signals)

## 🔍 RSI Patterns

**Overbought Conditions:**
• RSI above 70
• Price making higher highs
• Potential bearish reversal
• Look for divergence

**Oversold Conditions:**
• RSI below 30
• Price making lower lows
• Potential bullish reversal
• Volume confirmation helps

**Divergence Types:**
• **Bullish Divergence** — Price lower lows, RSI higher lows
• **Bearish Divergence** — Price higher highs, RSI lower highs
• **Hidden Divergence** — Trend continuation signals

## ⚠️ When RSI Lies

**False Signals:**
• Strong trends can stay overbought/oversold
• RSI can diverge for extended periods
• News events can override technical signals
• Multiple timeframe analysis needed

**Better Context:**
• Use with trend analysis
• Confirm with volume
• Check multiple timeframes
• Combine with other indicators

## 💡 Why No XP Yet
RSI mastery comes from understanding its limitations and combining it with other tools for confirmation.

## 📝 Mini-Task (Optional)
Find a chart with RSI and identify: 1) Current RSI level, 2) Any divergence patterns, 3) Whether it's giving a buy/sell signal, and 4) What other indicators might confirm this signal.

assignment.title: ✅ Final Course Assignment: Multi-Indicator Chart Breakdown
assignment.instructions:
## 📦 Deliverables

**Screenshot of a chart** (any asset, any timeframe) marked-up with:

• **Candlestick pattern** or trend observation
• **RSI reading** or divergence noted
• **Bollinger Band positioning** (squeeze, breakout, or mean reversion)
• **Fibonacci retracement/extension zones**
• **Short written breakdown** (4–6 sentences) explaining how these tools align

## 🎯 Requirements

• Use at least 3 of the 4 indicators covered
• Show clear annotations on the chart
• Explain the confluence of signals
• Include your trading bias (bullish/bearish)
• Suggest potential entry/exit points

## 📤 Submission Format

Submit as either:
• A screenshot with markup
• A Google/Notion Doc with embedded chart
• A PDF with annotations

## 💡 Pro Tips

• Choose a recent chart with clear signals
• Look for multiple confirmations
• Be specific about your analysis
• Quality over quantity
• Show your thinking process
assignment.bonus_criteria: Clear, well-annotated chart + accurate multi-tool analysis (awarded by Academy team)
